reviews.review_msg: She was alright, BUS 202 is a pretty easy class itself and I enjoyed most of it. Never really learnt anything that value from her lectures. She adds alot of group work which made the class less boring.
A boring class, Ive never seen the entry class so boring and so many things

This is an easy course so the instructor does not really matter. Shauna will often incorporate group discussions, videos, assessment tools, personal examples, and ask questions in class, so you'll never know when the class is over. For an A, ask questions, do pre-readings, follow grading criteria, show understanding of course concepts.
She is just one of those people who annoys you. Test was extremely difficult. Assignments are not related to business at all. Just about reflection. stupid class

Shauna is very egotistical for no reason, considering her pathetic credibility in her whole career. Her instructions are very broad, and horribly expressed. The content assigned are pretty useless and generic. Moreover, she is extremely rude towards students. She mentioned she has a stepson, which makes sense because who would ever want her?

Asks for feedback during lecture, takes notes and nods her head ("mhmm...") as if she is going to act on it. The fire alarm literally rang outside of our class and she says "well it's not ringing in our room" and continues to lecture. WHAT?!? She only stopped when another staff member opened our door and yelled at us to get out (true story)

Excellent professor who helps you learn and reflect on your life. The marking is tough and group marks make up a huge portion of your grades. One of the nicest people you will ever meet. Thank you Shauna!

The prof has severe ego issues.The course is based on participation and team work if you are having trouble with your team just BS your way though her assignments. Marking for assignments is very bad so always proactive approach to them (Ask prof or TA to explain HW ). Assignment are only one page but the requirements are too many
Literally just tie in course concepts from lecture, readings and videos in your individual and group assignments and your good to go. Assignment instructions are pretty confusing sometimes though.

Individual work consists of reflections and feedback which is honestly pretty easy if you just tie in course concepts. Same with group projects, youll have to meet with your group outside of class to finish the work(time consuming) honestly pretty easy, but very repetitive, and confusing assignment guidelines. Lots of group work. But Not that bad

Shauna is a terrible prof. She is very rude and unprofessional. The course is useless and yet she manages to make it really hard. She assigns a lot of homework but barely gives any time to complete it. Her expectations for assignments are never clear and the TAs mark very hard. If you care about your GPA don't take this course with Shauna.

Awful prof. Would not recommend her for any class. She marked hard, seemed rude, and gave so many assignments due in a week. The class is already useless but she makes it harder than it needs to be. The whole class is dependent on group work. It is hard to fail the class so that's a plus but if you can take it with another prof, I would.
Terrible prof, agree with all the other comments. Easy class, prof didnt teach me anything and was not respectful.

I will be straight. Is this course challenging? Yes. Is Shauna a good prof? Yes. The ratings on here equate poor performances in BUS202 to a professor problem but that is not the case. Shauna is caring, creates an inclusive environment, and there for u. It is the students responsibility to take this class seriously and find value in it. I did.

Shauna Jones is by far, the worst prof I ever had at SFU. Seeing that BUS 202 is a mandatory course in your first semester in Beedie, I truly don't know if SFU wants to continue having her as the first Beedie professor students encounter when they get accepted into the school of business. Do it with ANY other prof than her.
not respect to students
The worst prof I've every had during my four-year studies in Beedie. She is a horrible person and has no respect for students.

I like the intention of this course but there is a lack of focus on the course material. I still don't get why the "Core Strength" test is placed with so much focus, it is just some personality test that is true to some extent. Stop treating it as some "solution for all things" test and instead give students more time to focus on the BPME project.
worst course ever. not a good prof as well.

The worst course forever. Grading is not based on curve/cut-off but only by her impression to your team. How come 79.81% can get a C+ but 80.5% can have a B? Ridiculous grading and SFU should cut this course out/make it into a non-credit course. The task team interview is the time to determine her impression to your team. Bad teama bad grade

Shauna's classes contain a lot of "fluff". Showing up is mandatory and the expectations can be very unclear from the get-go. Group work makes a huge portion of your grade. Communicate with your TA religiously, especially with your reflections. The class itself is pretty useless but if you have a decent group and manage your time it's an easy grade

Most unpredictable teacher  I ever had. Disorganized, and chaos are the best describe of her summit.  She tells you to grade you peers on the true performance, and then she grades down what you receive because of 'over-inflation'. However, when you take a look at the average, you discover it is higher than what you get. Wouldn't recommend her ever.

If you want a good grade in this course, you need a good group with people who care. You can't do anything but hope for the best. It sucks because I was put in a bad group with most people who didn't care. This course has many flaws.

Pretty disorganized. Assignment outlines are vague and full of overlaps. Expects a ton of detail but sets very restricting word/page limits. Tells students not to worry about taking notes cause she'll post slides on Canvas, but then doesn't do so. Also tells students that their grades don't matter, which is kind of ridiculous. At least she's nice?

Shauna is really nice and is willing to help her students. My only problem with this class was with the administration. The criteria and guidelines were not clear and were up late in some cases. Most important tip in this class is to be very specific and elaborate on what you're saying in order to be perfectly clear.
She made my first term at sfu great, thank you!
The curve is your friend 3 I'm not sure how she does it but your grades will always be higher than what you get

Made my first experience at SFU great. This was a required course and I'll be honest, I was expecting it to be tough. However, the easy and simplicity brought to us through her lectures was extraordinary. Please take her, you won't regret it.
fair grader, super helpful, took for 202, managed an A in her class

She is helpful. Marking is a bit skewed; no standard marking scheme across the board. Textbook necessary for readings. She curves down if average too high. This class wasnt taught as clean as the intention to incorporate collaboration through marketing & selling a product together. SO MUCH WRITING.
She is not a good professor, and not fair in this class.

A course intended to help students though, but requirements are not so clear, and the grades they give you are mostly subjective, I learnt something but not from the instructor, she seem not that professional to teach students, and the textbook is useless don't know why they asked us to buy it.

The absolute worst. A tough look for Beedie to have this guy first thing into entering. Disappointed because you work so hard to get into Beedie then this dude treats you like a 12 year old. Avoid at all cost.

It insults me that this person has rationalized their employment to SFU. Her class is similar to the spring of the mill summer camp your parents send you to try and repair their broken marriage on a whim. Expect to learn nothing just regurgitate what ever she posts on the on the slides. She makes the comprehensive exam sound harder than it is.
disorganizedï¼Œnot following lecture
She is very unorganized, and given students, I don't know what I am doing! Neve replied to the email...

BUS 201 is a pretty useless class as it's pass/fail. Matt was a really great professor though, he talked about his own experiences at SFU as well as his career path, which was inspiring. Just complete the assignments and you'll do fine. Reach out to him outside of class too for some good career advice!

My low rating is directed at the course itself rather than Matt, as he is a nice guy and a great teacher. However, marking across the Ta's is extremely inconsistent and ambiguous regarding the criteria for certain assignments. I don't think this should be a mandatory course for transfer students as many of us know what our concentration will be.

This is the most stupid and ridiculous class Ive ever taken and heard of in my life. This class is stupid, useless, nonsense and you can't luterally learn anything from. It's a waste of money, they have this class for taking the money from you!

Matt is a caring prof and a nice dude.  He is frequently available outside of class to help with clarification on assignments and projects.  His lectures were interesting, but the class structure was questionable.  Half of the class time was usually spent discussing assigned readings with classmates, which made a number of students disconnect.
BUS 202/201/100 are all the same, all useless, waste of time and money. This is the reason why ppl think business is for kids
Worst professor ever do not take classes with him.

Honestly, he wasn't as bad as the ratings made him out to be and I think its because he looked at the feedback he had gotten. The prof was good but the class was useless with the content and groupwork you had to do. There were weekly in-class discussions which felt pointless and only one midterm where you had to memorize all the readings.

His grading criteria is very vague, which is made worse by the fact that he takes a very long time to get grades back for assignments. Also, specifically for 202 since the concepts are very basic, his exams are marked in a way that you have to word for word explain the concepts or else you may end up with a lot of part marks or even no marks.
Class was lazily administered - material and grades delivered late. Assignments were extremely unclear and graded very tough.

Waiting for his marks was brutal. Marking criteria was very subjective and unclear. He also never released participation mark on canvas. His class and assignments are messy and impossible for improvement. He failed to release quizzes for students to prep for the test as well. 
This course supposed to be grade booster until Matt is your instructor.

His course lacks organization, with lecture slides often posted last minute or not at all. Reading materials for assignments are released just before the deadline and are lengthy. Participation is mandatory, and the grading system is subjective and harsh. He never respond to emails and only provides assignment marks at the end of the semester.
The worst class that I have ever had in my life. Attendance is mandatory; this course is VERY disorganized; he did not mark anything on time, the criteria were very unclear
kinda tougher than I expected for a 200lvl class
Bad
avoid at all cost

Lots of assignments barely made it through with the number of readings and assignments due. Your mark depends heavily on the TA, as Matt does not mark the assignments. I was lucky enough to have great team members for projects. This course was alright but was mandatory.
